Activity

Customers report that they are unable to view web pages from a web server located at the ISP.

Place the actions taken by the technician into the correct troubleshooting method category.
The technician suspects that a firewall is causing the problem, and checks the firewall configuration.
The technician checks the cable connections between the web server and the directly connected switch.
The technician pings the server and then pings the switch located at the customer site.
The technician calls the customer in order to determine if only web applications are affected.
The technician checks the lights on the network interface card in the web server.
The technician verifies that the server has the correct DNS entry and that it is resolving the name.
Please review the troubleshooting methods and try again.
You have placed the actions taken by the technician into the correct troubleshooting method category. Click Next to continue.
